entities.name: Company
entities.description: A legally recognized business entity involved in commercial, industrial, or professional activities.

entities.name: Subsidiary
entities.description: A company controlled by another company, known as the parent company.

entities.name: Asset
entities.description: Resources owned by the company that are expected to provide future economic benefits.

entities.name: Liability
entities.description: Financial obligations of a company that it is required to pay in the future.

entities.name: Equity
entities.description: Ownership value in the company represented by shares.

entities.name: Revenue
entities.description: Total income generated from normal business operations.

entities.name: Expense
entities.description: Money spent or costs incurred in an organization's efforts to generate revenue.

entities.name: Profit
entities.description: The financial gain realized when the amount of revenue gained exceeds the expenses and taxes needed to sustain the activity.

entities.name: Debt
entities.description: An amount of money borrowed by the company to be paid back at a later date.

entities.name: Investment
entities.description: Money committed or property acquired for future income.

entities.name: Dividend
entities.description: A sum of money paid regularly by a company to its shareholders out of its profits.

entities.name: Bond
entities.description: A fixed income instrument that represents a loan made by an investor to a borrower.

entities.name: Stock
entities.description: Type of security that signifies proportionate ownership in the issuing corporation.

entities.name: Option
entities.description: Contracts that give the buyer the right, but not the obligation, to buy or sell an underlying asset at a set price on or before a certain date.

entities.name: Derivative
entities.description: A financial security with a value that is reliant upon or derived from, an underlying asset or group of assets.

entities.name: Hedge Fund
entities.description: An alternative investment vehicle available only to sophisticated investors, such as institutions and individuals with significant assets.

entities.name: Mutual Fund
entities.description: An investment program funded by shareholders that trades in diversified holdings and is professionally managed.

entities.name: Exchange-Traded Fund (ETF)
entities.description: A type of security that involves a collection of securities—such as stocks—that often tracks an underlying index.

entities.name: Audit
entities.description: A systematic review and assessment of information or documents.

entities.name: Tax
entities.description: A financial charge or other levy imposed upon a taxpayer by a governmental organization.

entities.name: Regulatory Filing
entities.description: Official documents filed to comply with regulations imposed by financial authorities.

entities.name: Compliance Report
entities.description: A document or set of documents that detail a company's adherence to regulatory guidelines.

entities.name: Insider Trading
entities.description: The trading of a public company's stock or other securities by individuals with access to non-public information about the company.

entities.name: Merger
entities.description: A combination of two companies to form a new entity.

entities.name: Acquisition
entities.description: The process of acquiring control of another corporation by purchase or stock exchange.

entities.name: IPO
entities.description: Initial public offering, or the process by which a private company can go public by sale of its stocks to general public.

entities.name: Market Cap
entities.description: The market value of a company's outstanding shares.

entities.name: Credit Rating
entities.description: An evaluation of the credit risk of a prospective debtor, predicting their ability to pay back the debt.

entities.name: Leverage
entities.description: The use of various financial instruments or borrowed capital to increase the potential return of an investment.

entities.name: Interest Rate
entities.description: The amount charged, expressed as a percentage of principal, by a lender to a borrower for the use of assets.

entities.name: Financial Analyst
entities.description: A professional who performs financial analysis for external or internal clients as a core part of the job.

entities.name: Regulator
entities.description: An authority or agency responsible for exercising autonomous authority over some area of human activity in a regulatory or supervisory capacity.

entities.name: Economic Indicator
entities.description: A statistic about an economic activity, allowing analysis of economic performance and predictions of future performance.

entities.name: Financial Statement
entities.description: A formal record of the financial activities and position of a business, person, or other entity.

relations.name: owns
relations.description: Indicates ownership or control of one entity over another.

relations.name: controls
relations.description: Denotes the governance or directional influence over operations and management of an entity.

relations.name: reports to
relations.description: An entity, typically a person, who is answerable to a higher body.

relations.name: pays
relations.description: A transfer of money, typically as payment.

relations.name: borrows
relations.description: The action of receiving something from someone with the expectation of returning it or its equivalent.

relations.name: invests in
relations.description: The action of committing money or capital in order to gain a financial return.

relations.name: issued by
relations.description: Typically refers to financial instruments or products being made available by an entity.

relations.name: regulated by
relations.description: Being subject to the guidance or control of a regulatory authority.

relations.name: complies with
relations.description: Conforming to a rule, such as a specification, policy, standard or law.

relations.name: violates
relations.description: Fail to comply with rules, regulations, or agreements.

relations.name: audited by
relations.description: The process of an audit being carried out by an auditor or regulatory body.

relations.name: acquires
relations.description: One entity taking ownership of another.

relations.name: merges with
relations.description: Combination of two entities to form a new one.

relations.name: listed on
relations.description: The action of being included on a list or register, typically in the context of a stock exchange.
